result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Elliot Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 6-2-15, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive. Cash bail to apply.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.
REPORT IN DATE: June 13, 2014 at 8:00am. If defendant fails to report, defendant shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Elliot Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From Pro Seal, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Matthew Elliot Smith in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.

REPORT IN DATE:  JUNE 13, 2014 at 8:00 am.
If defendant fails to report, defendant shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 6/2/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Defendant Matthew Elliot Smith in court.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinle not in court.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Defense counsel unavailable for sentencing and contacted the court early to adjourn.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 6/2/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Materials for sentencing, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Matthew Elliot Smith in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 5/6/2014 at 8:30 am,  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. branch 3.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Elliot Smith in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 3/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Matthew Elliot Smith in court with attorney Michael John steinle.  Danielle Chojnacki for Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Elliot Smith in court.  Step Nolten for Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant informs the Court that he is in the process of obtaining Attorney Steinle, Attorney Steinle is not present for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch PE. Court informs the defendant that defense counsel is to be present at the next scheduled court date.  Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Any remaining bail to be returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew Elliot Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
14RM000230  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 01-01-2014
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01/03/2014 @ 1:30pm
